net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.nonsense

Class NonsenseBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.nonsense.NonsenseBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NonsenseGenerator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NonsenseBuilderTest.ExposedNonsenseBuilder

    public class NonsenseBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements NonsenseGenerator
    The canonical implementation of NonsenseGenerator.

    The builder will assemble a sentence of the following form: adjective subject adverb verb adjective object phrase. The terms listed in bold (subject, verb, object) will always be rendered, while the terms in italics (adjectives, adverbs, additional phrases) will be added randomly based on the builder's configuration, which can be tuned by creating a custom instance of the NonsenseBuilder.Configuration inner class.

    The class uses the following string resources to get its random words:

    • R.array#asNonsenseNouns
    • R.array#asNonsenseVerbs
    • R.array#asNonsenseAdjectives
    • R.array#asNonsenseAdverbs
    • R.array#asNonsensePhrases

    Applications using this class may choose to have overrides for any or all of these string resources, in order to customize the text that might be rendered in the randomized sentences.

    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.0.1 (#7)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  NonsenseBuilder.Configuration
      This class controls aspects of a NonsenseBuilder related to the probability of certain random features.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static NonsenseBuilder.Configuration CANONICAL_CONFIGURATION
      A canonical instance of a NonsenseBuilder.Configuration, using the default values defined in that inner class.
      protected NonsenseBuilder.Configuration m_cfg
      The configuration settings that will control the random elements of the builder.
      protected android.content.Context m_ctx
      A context in which string resources are available.
      protected java.lang.String m_sObject
      (noun) The object of the sentence.
      protected java.lang.String m_sObjectAdjective
      (adjective) A modifier of the object of the sentence.
      protected java.lang.String m_sObjectModifier
      (prepositional phrase) A phrase further modifying the object of the sentence.
      protected java.lang.String m_sSubject
      (noun) The subject of the sentence.
      protected java.lang.String m_sSubjectAdjective
      (adjective) A modifier of the subject.
      protected java.lang.String m_sVerb
      (verb) The action verb in the sentence.
      protected java.lang.String m_sVerbAdverb
      (adverb) A modifier of the sentence's verb.
      protected static java.util.Random RANDOM
      The internal RNG of the builder, used to determine the value selected for each item in the sentence, and the presence of certain optional items.

        protected android.content.Context m_ctx
        A context in which string resources are available.

      • m_cfg

        protected NonsenseBuilder.Configuration m_cfg
        The configuration settings that will control the random elements of the builder. This defaults to the CANONICAL_CONFIGURATION.

      • m_sSubject

        protected java.lang.String m_sSubject
        (noun) The subject of the sentence. This is always set by the builder.

      • m_sSubjectAdjective

        protected java.lang.String m_sSubjectAdjective
        (adjective) A modifier of the subject. This is randomly set by the builder.

      • m_sVerb

        protected java.lang.String m_sVerb
        (verb) The action verb in the sentence. This is always set by the builder.

      • m_sVerbAdverb

        protected java.lang.String m_sVerbAdverb
        (adverb) A modifier of the sentence's verb. This is randomly set by the builder.

      • m_sObject

        protected java.lang.String m_sObject
        (noun) The object of the sentence. This is always set by the builder.

      • m_sObjectAdjective

        protected java.lang.String m_sObjectAdjective
        (adjective) A modifier of the object of the sentence. This is randomly set by the builder.

      • m_sObjectModifier

        protected java.lang.String m_sObjectModifier
        (prepositional phrase) A phrase further modifying the object of the sentence. This is randomly set by the builder.

      • setContext

        public NonsenseBuilder setContext(android.content.Context ctx)
        Description copied from interface: NonsenseGenerator
        Sets the context in which string resources can be fetched. If this context has not yet been set, then the class will not be able to fetch string resources to assemble the nonsense string. Implementations of this interface should also provide a constructor which sets this context upfront.
        Specified by:
        setContext in interface NonsenseGenerator
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which string resources are available
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • setSubject

        public NonsenseBuilder setSubject(java.lang.String sSubject)
        Locks a value for the subject of the sentence. If null is specified, then the builder's subject will be "cleared", meaning that it will be chosen at random.
        Parameters:
        sSubject - a specific subject for the sentence, or null to ensure that the subject is randomized
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • setSubjectAdjective

        public NonsenseBuilder setSubjectAdjective(java.lang.String sAdj)
        Locks a value for the adjective modifying the subject of the sentence. If null is specified, then the builder might or might not add a random adjective, as specified by NonsenseBuilder.Configuration.m_nSubjectAdjectiveChance.
        Parameters:
        sAdj - a specific adjective to modify the subject of the sentence, or null to randomize the presence and value of the adjective
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • setVerb

        public NonsenseBuilder setVerb(java.lang.String sVerb)
        Locks a value for the verb of the sentence. If null is specified, then the builder's verb will be "cleared", meaning that it will be chosen at random.
        Parameters:
        sVerb - a specific verb for the sentence, or null to ensure that the verb is randomized
        Returns:
        (fluid)

        public NonsenseBuilder setAdverb(java.lang.String sAdverb)

        Parameters:
        sAdverb - a specific adverb to modify the verb of the sentence, or null to randomize the presence and value of the adverb

        (fluid)

        Parameters:
        sObject - a specific object for the sentence, or null to ensure that the object is randomized
        Returns:
        (fluid)

        Parameters:
        sAdj - a specific adjective to modify the object of the sentence, or null to randomize the presence and value of the adjective
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • setObjectModifier

        public NonsenseBuilder setObjectModifier(java.lang.String sPhrase)
        Locks a value for additional text (expected to be a prepositional phrase) modifying the object of the sentence. If null is specified, then the builder might or might not add a random phrase, as specified by NonsenseBuilder.Configuration.m_nObjectPhraseChance.
        Parameters:
        sPhrase - specific text to modify the object of the sentence, or null to randomize the presence and value of such text
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • getRandomNonsense

        public java.lang.String getRandomNonsense(int resStrings,
                                          int nChance)
        Randomly selects a string resource from the selected string array.
        Parameters:
        resStrings - the resource ID of a string array
        nChance - chance that we should return anything at all, expressed as a percentage (expected range [0,100])
        Returns:
        a random string from that array of strings

      • hasArticle

        protected static boolean hasArticle(java.lang.String sNoun)
        Given a string, indicates whether that string begins with an article, which must be split from the front of the subject/object string to insert an adjective
        Parameters:
        sNoun - the subject or object resource which might begin with an article
        Returns:
        true iff the string resource begins with an article

      • whichIndefiniteArticle

        protected static java.lang.String whichIndefiniteArticle(java.lang.String sNextWord,
                                                         boolean bCapitalize)
        Used to re-evaluate which indefinite article should be appended to the sentence, given a new "next word" which must be inserted.
        Parameters:
        sNextWord - the new "next word" in the sentence, which wasn't the noun we thought we were going to get
        bCapitalize - indicates whether the article should be capitalized
        Returns:
        "a" or "an"
